Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned a lot of vocabulary related to the world of business and gained a much better understanding of economic trends and cultural differences in ways of doing business.
Communication skills, French Business culture

Greatly helped speaking skills and conversational fluency.
V interesting insight into different areas of business and economy in france
I learned about different aspects of business in france regarding workers rights, strikes, and different business models.
great for speaking and presentation practice.
I learned a lot about business in French! It was also a great class to practice speaking French.
I was able to improve my spoken and written french by constant reading and oral presentations. I was also able to improve my oratory skills in general.
You learn a ton about French business through all of the readings.

I came into this course with very little knowledge of business or business in France. I gained a lot of new knowledge on the structure and organization of various companies, historical issues as well as contemporary trends.

This course allowed us to further develop, and perfect, our French language skills in the area of business. We discusses multiple aspects of the French economy, and how it ties into French politics, which was very interesting and insightful. We held multiple presentations which allowed us to further develop our speaking skills.

This course had a well-chosen films and readings that were genuinely interesting to someone who doesn't know much about economics. I thought the film screenings could have been more conveniently scheduled so I didn't have to keep going to the Film Study Center to watch them.

Strenghts - many conversations, presentations; improves speaking skills
Weaknesses - long readings, difficult to deeply engage with course topic since reading and understanding takes time

Most of the work for the course was reading which was very passive.
My learning and engagement would have benefited from more regular interactive/proactive work

Very good, comprehensive feedback after presentations and written assignments. Was very clear and specific
This course could have facilitated discussions better by being less strictly focused on answering questions about he readings, but talking more generally about the themes discussed.
wish i could get more feedback on my writing in a non-assessed way in order to improve writing for the assesments

Strength: great conversations in French and required presentation to help improve speaking 
Weakness: the class could use more interesting topics in business for discussions

It is an engaging course with interesting material. It is geared more towards being better fluent in speaking french than writing which was great since most other french courses cater for writing and grammar.

Grades are very heavily based around a couple of presentations and essays while discussions in class mostly cover the readings. Perhaps having fewer presentations and more short reading responses would improve understanding each article/chapter/essay.

I found some of the readings a little too technical considering I have no prior experience with business so I felt as though I didnt understand as much from the readings as from the class discussions.

I highly enjoyed the course as it allowed for a lot of in class discussion, which is fundamental for improving language skills. The weekly course load was appropriate and the assignments were fun and engaging. The course could have been improved in terms of its structure. Even though all of the subjects were interesting, it was difficult to find a connection and overview at times.
I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys studying economics or who knows very little about the subject but is interested in learning something new.
Yes, because the workload is not too high, but French skills are being greatly improved, especially because the instructor is a native speaker.
Would definitely recommend. Great prof, small class which made it very interactive, thought-provoking topics and discussions
yes, if you are interested in learning about the structure of businesses in france.
yes good french credit and professor is great
Yes! please take this class if you want to improve speaking in French and learn about business in France. Professor Tertrain is wonderful!
It is a great course to upkeep or improve oratory and research skills. I would definitely recommend it to other students.

I would recommend this course if you're looking for a class where you can read and peak a bunch in French and improve your language skills, but aren't looking for a heavy writing/literature course. Also, if you're fluent in French and really want to learn more about French business.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students because it was really interesting to apply my French abilities so a new topic. It was so different than other French grammar courses that I have taken in the past.

I would recommend this student who has a solid grip of the French language, and is looking to improve their writing and speaking skills. It is helpful if students know about the economy and business in France, but it is not necessary.
